lcInstruction.p:
When a DITA topic containing a conref referencing element is processed for output (or displayed in some DITA editors), the output generator replaces the referencing element with the referenced element and all the content of referenced element. This includes any elements contained within the referenced element. For example, if a referenced

element contains a element, the referencing

element is replaced by the referenced

element and the element contained within it. Similarly, a conref to an

    element includes all the
  1. elements that are contained by the
      element.

A conref directly references a reused element using its location and ID. The location is the path to the topic that contains the reused content, and the id is the ID of the element to be reused. In DITA not every element requires an ID, but it is required for any reused element.
lcInstruction.note: If the element you want to reuse does not have an ID, your DITA editor or content management system might prompt you to create an ID for the reused element as one of the steps in creating the conref. An ID must start with a letter, number, or underscore.
